text: Potential cis - acting regulatory elements in the LPS responsive region of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter
Mouse and human nucleotide sequences were aligned using Clustal W software .
Cis - acting elements conserved between the human and murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoters are boxed and labeled .

AP-1 = activator protein 1 ; C / EBP = CCAAT enhancer binding protein ; CRE = cAMP response element ; <extra_id_0> Oct1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> = <extra_id_0> octamer transcription factor 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> POU2F1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> = <extra_id_0> purine box binding protein 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The putative transcription initiation site ( tis ) is indicated and exon 1 is presented in uppercase .
The location of the 5 ' ends of the -539 , -189 and -87 reporter constructs are also shown .
